references.paper_title: Using synthetic controls: Feasibility, data requirements, and methodological aspects.
references.reason: This paper provides a foundational overview of synthetic control methods, a crucial technique used for causal inference in the presence of time-varying treatments, which is central to the methodology in the current paper.

This paper introduces the concept of synthetic interventions, extending causal inference to combinatorial settings, which is closely related to the compositional approach explored in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Matrix completion methods for causal panel data models.
references.reason: This paper applies matrix completion techniques to causal panel data, providing a relevant methodological framework for handling missing data and high dimensionality, issues addressed in this paper.

references.paper_title: An exact and robust conformal inference method for counterfactual and synthetic controls.
references.reason: This paper offers a robust conformal inference method for counterfactuals, relevant to the uncertainty quantification methods used in this paper.

references.paper_title: Causality: Models, Reasoning and Inference, 2nd edition.
references.reason: This book is a seminal work in causal inference, laying the theoretical foundation for many of the causal concepts and techniques used in this paper.
